alert.note: Alert for Owyhee Mountains; Southern Highlands; Western Twin Falls BLM (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 27 at 2:51AM MDT until July 27 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ON THURSDAY... .Gusty southwest winds with very low relative humidity will continue through early this evening across Southwest Idaho, especially near the Nevada border before subsiding overnight. West to southwest winds will become gusty once again Thursday afternoon and early evening with very low relative humidity. The dry and windy combination will result in critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR OWYHEE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN HIGHLANDS...WHICH ARE FIRE WEATHER ZONES 423 AND 426......RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 9 PM MDT THURSDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR OWYHEE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN HIGHLANDS...WHICH ARE FIRE WEATHER ZONES 423 AND 426... The National Weather Service in Boise has cancelled the Red Flag Warning. * WINDS...Winds have dropped below Red Flag criteria for the remainder of the evening, but winds will increase once again Thursday afternoon to West to southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...8 to 15 percent.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will occur shortly.

area.areaDesc: Owyhee Mountains; Southern Highlands; Western Twin Falls BLM
